title: CVE-2017-5484 The ATM parser in tcpdump before 4.9.0 has a buffer overflow in print-atm.c:sig_print()
content: Reported to the project maintainers in 2016. The function sig_print() did receive a correct caplen parameter value but didn't use it correctly which could result in a read outside of buffer. Fixed by https://github.com/the-tcpdump-group/tcpdump/commit/5d214e36eed3565fbdc0f9b527bbc33a6bb63972.
steps: Identify a target system running tcpdump version before 4.9.0.
Craft a malicious ATM packet that triggers the buffer overflow in the sig_print() function by exploiting the incorrect use of the caplen parameter.
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a buffer overflow in the ATM parser of tcpdump before version 4.9.0, specifically in the sig_print() function in print-atm.c. The function receives a correct caplen parameter but does not use it properly, leading to a potential read outside the buffer bounds. This could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service or potentially execute arbitrary code.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward buffer overflow due to incorrect parameter handling. It does not require multiple components, complex state manipulation, or novel logic. The issue is localized to a single function and its misuse of a parameter.
